page.title: 14Eartham Village.
page.content: This village is a small typically Sussex village, with neat and tidy flint and brick cottages. The residents of the village are, in the main, farm workers, commuters and retired people. They number less than 100. There is a charming 12th century church,a manor house,now Great Ballard Preparaory School,and a public house, The George Inn. This is a small friendly pub.,with a restaurant and a large garden for summer use. The village is small and has no State school,shops,post office or regular bus service, but for all that has a great deal of unspoilt charm. There is a bird sanctury,Brent Loadge,where injured birds are cared for. The whole village is surrounded by farm land and forest plantations, so is ideal for starting interesting walks from.
